result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard N Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

8:26.  Defendant, Richard N Nelson,   in court with attorney Alexander Stormont.  Kurt F Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; Deft, stands mute, 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Court enters NG pleas and orders the previous.

9:03 - Defendant Richard N Nelson in court with attorney Alexander Stormont.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
